intro: Freycinetia latispina, commonly known as the broad-spined screw pine, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its spirally arranged, slender leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a globose capsule that splits open to release seeds. Freycinetia latispina is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to saline environments.
